message_1:
Suppose we have a plaintext message "MATH" in Hill Cipher with the encryption key 
$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 5 \end{bmatrix}$.
What is the corresponding ciphertext?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATH" using the Hill Cipher with the given encryption key, we first need to convert the letters to their corresponding numerical values (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25). 

MATH -> 12 0 19 7

Next, we arrange these values into a column vector and multiply it by the encryption key matrix:

$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 5 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 12 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 24 \\ 36 \end{bmatrix}$

$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 5 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 19 \\ 7 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 33 \\ 68 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we need to take the resulting values modulo 26 to get the numerical values of the ciphertext:

$\begin{bmatrix} 24 \\ 36 \end{bmatrix} \pmod{26} = \begin{bmatrix} 24 \\ 10 \end{bmatrix}$

$\begin{bmatrix} 33 \\ 68 \end{bmatrix} \pmod{26} = \begin{bmatrix} 7 \\ 16 \end{bmatrix}$

Finally, we convert these numerical values back to letters:

24 10 7 16 -> Y K H Q

So, the ciphertext for the plaintext message "MATH" using the given Hill Cipher encryption key is "YKHQ".
